Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant's release from the Canadian Armed Forces was procedurally fair and in accordance with applicable regulations
Application_Facts: The applicant failed to achieve required qualifications despite multiple opportunities; medical and positive assessments were noted but not decisive
Decision_Outcome: The judicial review application was dismissed
Court_Ruling: The court found no procedural errors or failures of natural justice in the CDS's decision
Defendant_Behavior: The DPCOR initially mishandled the release procedurally; the CDS corrected the error and approved the release after review
Grounds_for_Claim: Procedural unfairness in the release process
Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness and jurisdictional authority under QRO
Assessment_Factor: Applicant's failure to meet technical qualifications, objections raised, prior procedural error, and evidence considered by CDS
Applicable_Legislation: Queen's Regulations and Orders (QRO) articles 15.01(3) and 15.03
Procedural_Issue: Initial procedural error by DPCOR in approving release without proper authority
Review_Standard: Judicial review of procedural fairness and compliance with QRO
Evidence_Used: Medical assessments, performance evaluations, objections submitted by applicant
Application_Basis: Failure to meet required qualifications and procedural correction by CDS
Relief_Sought: Judicial review of the release decision
Cause_Description: Applicant's failure to meet technical qualifications led to release recommendations; initial procedural error occurred but was corrected
Evidence_Handling: CDS reviewed all relevant evidence including objections and assessments before decision
Jurisdictional_Issue: Authority of CDS to approve release under QRO
Evidence_Assessment: CDS considered all relevant factors including objections and medical information
Decision_Rationale: Release was procedurally fair and within jurisdictional bounds after CDS review and correction of error
Legal_Standard_Applied: Procedural fairness, adherence to QRO, proper exercise of authority
